title: Top 10 Big Island Guidebooks
text:
Expert Videos 
The Big Island is the youngest of the Hawaiian Islands and the only place on earth where you can see the land growing every day of the year as Kilauea volcano continues its eruption. 
From the top of Mauna Kea, the tallest mountain on earth to the Valley of Kings - the Waipio Valley - with its thousand foot cliffs, waterfalls and streams, the Big Island of Hawaii has something for everyone. Hawaii The Big Island Revealed: The Ultimate Guidebook. Andrew Doughty 1. Hawaii: The Big Island Revealed: The Ultimate Guidebook 
Hawaii: The Big Island Revealed is one of the best guidebooks dedicated solely to the Big Island of Hawaii. The book contains excellent maps and tips that will show you places that many tourists miss. This is a must buy if you are visiting the Big Island. More » Moon Handbooks Big Island of Hawaii. Bree Kessler 2. Moon Handbooks Big Island of Hawaii 
Bree Kesslet takes over the helm of this popular guide from the late J.D. Bisignani. The book is full of information about the culture, customs, geography and history of the Big Island. It also covers all forms of outdoor recreation and the natural environment and campgrounds; and includes information on accommodations, dining, and entertainment. More » The Rough Guide to the Big Island of Hawaii. Greg Ward 3. Rough Guide to the Big Island of Hawaii 
An invaluable source of information on the Big Island of Hawaii. Measuring only 4" x 6", this book easily fits into your purse or pocket, but don't mistake its compact size for a lack of information.This book is currently out of print, but check Amazon.com for a used copy. Hawaii The Big Island Trailblazer. Jerry Sprout and Janine Sprout 4. Hawaii The Big Island Trailblazer: Where to hike, snorkel, surf, bike, drive 
With its obscure roads and enormous size--nearly twice that of the rest of the Hawaiian Islands combined-the Big Island presents a challenge to adventure travelers who have limited time. Hawaii The Big Island Trailblazer for 2013 comes to the rescue with clear driving and trail descriptions to all of nature's all-stars, from the top of Mauna Kea to the shores of Kealakekua Bay. Presenting vivid maps and its easy-to-use format, Trailblazer is a personal tour guide that fits in your knapsack. Hikers, snorkelers, and surfers can zero in on all the island's scenic masterpieces, as well as seek out the quiet wonders the Sprouts are known to discover. More » Frommer's Portable Big Island of Hawaii. Jeanette Foster 5. Frommer's Portable: The Big Island of Hawaii 
A pocket size version of the Big Island section of the Frommer's Hawaii Guide by expert writer Jeanette Foster. The book contains excellent details on the best places to stay on the island and places to dine in all price categories. More » Lonely Planet Discover Hawaii the Big Island. Sara Benson and Luci Yamamoto 6. Lonely Planet Discover Hawaii the Big Island Whether youre looking to hike stunning Mauna Loa or laze on a perfect black-sand beach, this guide will show you how to live it up  or slow it down  on Hawaiis Big Island. You'll find out where to get good meals on any budget, learn about manta ray dives, volcano treks and more in a special activities chapter, select lodging options from campsites in the Valley of Kings to condos at Kailua. Includes 35 maps, including water sports and camping maps. More » Paradise Family Guides Big Island of Hawaii. Catherine Bridges Tarleton 7. Paradise Family Guides Big Island of Hawaii 
Ideal for families traveling with kids of any age — toddlers to teenagers — Paradise Family Guide Big Island Hawaii offers a blend of travel information unlike any other. With vacation ideas and tropical adventures that are sure to satisfy both action-hungry youngsters and relaxation-seeking parents, this guide meets the specific needs of each and every family member. This book is currently out of print, but check Amazon.com for a used copy. Hidden Big Island of Hawaii. Ray Riegert 8. Hidden Big Island of Hawaii 
Award-winning author and founder of the Hidden guidebooks series, Ray Riegert reveals how to best experience this magnificent island like a local. Hidden Big Island of Hawaii reviews the popular attractions -- such as diving coral reefs and scaling active volcanoes -- then invites readers to go further by exploring "hidden" spots other guides overlook, like an early morning fresh-fish auction, a rainforest zoo, and a secluded black-sand beach that has great surfing. This book is currently out of print, but check Amazon.com for a used copy. Hawai'i - The Best Beaches of the Big Island. Robert Frutos 
A guide to over 30 beaches around the island, describing setting, special features, snorkeling locations, amenities, and available activities. Also includes photos, a map, and general and specific cautions. More » Hawaii Trails. Kathy Morey 10. Hawai'i Trails: Walks, Strolls, and Treks on the Big Island The most comprehensive hiking guide available to the spectacular island of Hawaii. This island has a wealth of areas to explore, including: Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, the island's famous black sand beaches, shimmering blue bays, and remote rainforest valleys. Includes both dayhikes and backpacks. More » Related Articles
